snippet: Claudia Pechstein, Germany’s most decorated Winter Olympian, has challenged the fairness of the Court of Arbitration for Sport in a German court, and a ruling next month could drastically alter how justice is meted out in the sports arena.
abstract: Lawsuit brought by German speedskater Claudia Pechstein, now before Germany's Federal Court of Justice, could alter hierarchy of sports justice that defers to international Court of Arbitration for Sport for discipline; Pechstein, who was barred from two years of competition for alleged doping, is challenging CAS ruling and seeking damages for lost income.
lead_paragraph: Claudia Pechstein, Germany’s most decorated Winter Olympian, has challenged the fairness of the Court of Arbitration for Sport in a German court, and a ruling next month could drastically alter how justice is meted out in the sports arena.

headline.main: Speedskater Is Poised to Upend Rule of Sports’ Highest Court
headline.print_headline: Speedskater Is Poised to Upend Rule of Sports’ Highest Court
